intro: Setcreasea jaumavensis, commonly known as the Jaumavensian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue-violet blooms during the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
